definition: as before/as usual/(to be) like old friends
back to where we were (idiom); absolutely no improvement/Things haven't changed at all.

sentences.english: Liu Mengmei is swept off his feet by the ghost of Du Liniang. A romance unfolds.
sentences.chinese: 柳梦梅与夜访的杜丽娘一见如故，展开一段人鬼情。

sentences.english: No wonder she wins, for she is all old-shoe charm.
sentences.chinese: 难怪她获得胜利，因为她有令人一见如故的魅力。

sentences.english: Even after meeting only once, they felt a kinship.
sentences.chinese: 虽然只是一面之缘，但他们一见如故。

sentences.english: Perhaps we have the fortune, to meet one day. There's no need for any reticence .
sentences.chinese: 也许我们有缘，相逢某一天，一见如故无庸讳言。

sentences.english: Never ask me whether the changeable world will still be what it is tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 永远不要问，善变的世界明天是否依然如故。

sentences.english: How does a grown woman thank for a mother for continuing to be a mother?
sentences.chinese: 一个成年女子该怎样感谢母亲依然如故的角色？

sentences.english: But the misery of life back in their home town is never far away.
sentences.chinese: 但是他们家乡的苦难生活却依然如故。

sentences.english: To hit it off does not mean that you and the other person are in love. At least not yet!
sentences.chinese: 一见如故并不意味着两人陷入爱情，至少现在还没有。

sentences.english: But it still firmly lying there, remain unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 可它仍然稳稳地静卧在那里，依然如故。

sentences.english: Much as I hope I may gain weight- (yet) I i am still as thin as before.
sentences.chinese: 固然我很是希望补充体重，但我如故像以前一样的瘦。
时至今日，这些聚居区依然如故。

sentences.english: The spring term Qunfang jealousy, grind to dust scattered into the mud, only the fragrant as ever.
sentences.chinese: 春，一任群芳妒，零落成泥碾作尘，只有香如故。

sentences.english: We hit it off and became good friends.
sentences.chinese: 我们一见如故，成了好朋友。

sentences.english: All are that lonely, one toward as before.
sentences.chinese: 一切都是那么冷清，一往如故。

sentences.english: When they came to my humble abode once again, my affection towards them did not change.
sentences.chinese: 它们回到寒舍以后，我对它们的情感如故。

sentences.english: Today the time-honored elegance still pervades it.
sentences.chinese: 今天，弥漫其间的优雅风姿依然如故。

definition: back to where we were (idiom); absolutely no improvement/Things haven't changed at all.
the past/impurity contracted previously (in the sentient world) (Buddhism)
bear hardship with equanimity/regard wrongdoing with equanimity
The issue is in the past, and the situation has changed (idiom)./It is water under the bridge.
deep and somber/see also 窈窈[yao3 yao3]
things have remained the same, but people have changed
